title: Reported Speech - Complete Practice
description: Ejercicio completo de estilo indirecto que cubre afirmaciones, preguntas, órdenes y peticiones. Practica todos los cambios de tiempos verbales, pronombres y expresiones de tiempo.

questions.question: Sarah said: 'I am tired.' → How do we report this?

answerOptions.text: Sarah said that she was tired.
answerOptions.rationale: Correct! 'I' changes to 'she' and present 'am' changes to past 'was'.

answerOptions.text: Sarah said that I was tired.
answerOptions.rationale: The pronoun should change to 'she', not remain 'I'.

answerOptions.text: Sarah said that she is tired.
answerOptions.rationale: The tense should change from present to past: 'is' → 'was'.

answerOptions.text: Sarah told that she was tired.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Told' needs an object (told me/him/her). Use 'said' without object.

questions.hint: Remember: 'I' → 'he/she' and present → past in reported speech.

questions.question: Transform this direct speech to reported speech:
questionParts: Tom: 'I will call you later.' → Tom said that he
me later.
questions.hint: Remember: 'will' changes to 'would' in reported speech.

questions.question: How do we report: 'Do you like coffee?'

answerOptions.text: She asked if I liked coffee.
answerOptions.rationale: Perfect! Yes/No questions use 'if/whether' and statement order.

answerOptions.text: She asked do you like coffee.
answerOptions.rationale: Don't keep the question structure. Use statement order.

answerOptions.text: She asked that I liked coffee.
answerOptions.rationale: Use 'if/whether' for Yes/No questions, not 'that'.

answerOptions.text: She said if I liked coffee.
answerOptions.rationale: Use 'asked' for questions, not 'said'.

questions.hint: Yes/No questions in reported speech use 'if' or 'whether'.

questions.question: Complete the reported question:
questionParts: 'Where do you live?' → He asked where I
questions.hint: Wh- questions keep the question word but use statement order and past tense.

questions.question: Report this command: 'Close the door!'

answerOptions.text: He told me to close the door.
answerOptions.rationale: Correct! Commands use 'told + object + infinitive'.

answerOptions.text: He said me to close the door.
answerOptions.rationale: Use 'told' for commands, not 'said'. 'Said' doesn't take an object.

answerOptions.text: He asked to close the door.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Asked' is for requests. This is a command, so use 'told'.

answerOptions.text: He told that I close the door.
answerOptions.rationale: Commands use infinitive: 'told me TO close', not 'told that I close'.

questions.hint: Commands use 'told + object + to + infinitive'.

questions.question: How do we report: 'Please help me.'

answerOptions.text: She asked me to help her.
answerOptions.rationale: Perfect! Polite requests use 'asked + object + infinitive'.

answerOptions.text: She told me to help her.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Please' indicates a request, so use 'asked', not 'told'.

answerOptions.text: She said me to help her.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Said' doesn't take an object. Use 'asked me'.

answerOptions.text: She asked to help me.
answerOptions.rationale: The pronoun should change: 'me' in direct becomes 'her' in reported.

questions.hint: Polite requests use 'asked + object + to + infinitive'.

questions.question: Transform this negative command:
questionParts: 'Don't smoke here!' → He told us
there.
questions.hint: 'Don't' becomes 'not to' in reported speech.

questions.question: Mary said: 'I have finished my homework.' → Reported speech:

answerOptions.text: Mary said that she had finished her homework.
answerOptions.rationale: Correct! Present Perfect 'have finished' → Past Perfect 'had finished'.

answerOptions.text: Mary said that she has finished her homework.
answerOptions.rationale: Present Perfect should change to Past Perfect in reported speech.

answerOptions.text: Mary said that she finished her homework.
answerOptions.rationale: This changes the meaning. Use Past Perfect to maintain the original meaning.

answerOptions.text: Mary told that she had finished her homework.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Told' needs an object. Use 'said that' instead.

questions.hint: Present Perfect becomes Past Perfect in reported speech.

questions.question: Change the time expression:
questionParts: 'I'm busy today.' → She said she was busy
questions.hint: Time expressions change: 'today' becomes 'that day'.

questions.question: Transform: 'I went to Paris yesterday.'

answerOptions.text: He said he had gone to Paris the previous day.
answerOptions.rationale: Perfect! Past Simple → Past Perfect, 'yesterday' → 'the previous day'.

answerOptions.text: He said he went to Paris yesterday.
answerOptions.rationale: Both the tense and time expression should change.

answerOptions.text: He said he had gone to Paris yesterday.
answerOptions.rationale: Good tense change, but 'yesterday' should become 'the previous day'.

answerOptions.text: He said he goes to Paris the previous day.
answerOptions.rationale: Wrong tense. Past Simple should become Past Perfect.

questions.hint: Past Simple → Past Perfect, and change time expressions.

questions.question: Report this future statement:
questionParts: 'I'll see you tomorrow.' → She said she
me the following day.
questions.hint: 'Will' → 'would' and 'tomorrow' → 'the following day'.

questions.question: How do we report: 'Can you swim?'

answerOptions.text: She asked if I could swim.
answerOptions.rationale: Excellent! 'Can' → 'could' and Yes/No question uses 'if'.

answerOptions.text: She asked can I swim.
answerOptions.rationale: Don't keep question structure. Use statement order and change 'can' to 'could'.

answerOptions.text: She asked if I can swim.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Can' should change to 'could' in reported speech.

answerOptions.text: She said if I could swim.
answerOptions.rationale: Use 'asked' for questions, not 'said'.

questions.hint: 'Can' becomes 'could' in reported questions.

questions.question: Transform this modal verb:
questionParts: 'I must leave now.' → He said he
then.
questions.hint: 'Must' becomes 'had to' and 'now' becomes 'then'.

questions.question: Report: 'What time is it?'

answerOptions.text: She asked what time it was.
answerOptions.rationale: Perfect! Wh- questions keep the question word but use statement order.

answerOptions.text: She asked what time is it.
answerOptions.rationale: Use statement order: 'what time it was', not 'what time is it'.

answerOptions.text: She asked that what time it was.
answerOptions.rationale: Don't use 'that' with Wh- questions. Just 'asked what time...'.

answerOptions.text: She said what time it was.
answerOptions.rationale: Use 'asked' for questions, not 'said'.

questions.hint: Wh- questions use statement order: subject + verb.

questions.question: Change the location reference:
questionParts: 'I live here.' → He said he lived
questions.hint: Place references change: 'here' becomes 'there'.

questions.question: Transform: 'Why are you crying?'

answerOptions.text: She asked why I was crying.
answerOptions.rationale: Correct! Keep 'why', use statement order, and change tenses.

answerOptions.text: She asked why are you crying.
answerOptions.rationale: Use statement order and change pronouns: 'why I was crying'.

answerOptions.text: She asked that why I was crying.
answerOptions.rationale: Don't use 'that' with Wh- questions.

answerOptions.text: She asked why you were crying.
answerOptions.rationale: Change the pronoun: 'you' in direct speech becomes 'I' when reporting to the same person.

questions.hint: Keep the question word but change to statement order and adjust pronouns.

questions.question: Report this past continuous:
questionParts: 'I was working when you called.' → She said she
when I had called.
questions.hint: Past Continuous becomes Past Perfect Continuous in reported speech.

questions.question: How do we report: 'Have you ever been to London?'

answerOptions.text: He asked if I had ever been to London.
answerOptions.rationale: Perfect! Present Perfect → Past Perfect in Yes/No questions.

answerOptions.text: He asked have I ever been to London.
answerOptions.rationale: Use 'if' and statement order for Yes/No questions.

answerOptions.text: He asked if I have ever been to London.
answerOptions.rationale: Present Perfect should change to Past Perfect: 'had been'.

answerOptions.text: He said if I had ever been to London.
answerOptions.rationale: Use 'asked' for questions, not 'said'.

questions.hint: Present Perfect becomes Past Perfect in reported questions.

questions.question: Transform this polite request:
questionParts: 'Could you please open the window?' → She
the window.
questions.hint: Polite requests with 'could you please' become 'asked + object + to + infinitive'.

questions.question: Report: 'I may come to the party.'

answerOptions.text: She said she might come to the party.
answerOptions.rationale: Correct! 'May' often changes to 'might' in reported speech.

answerOptions.text: She said she may come to the party.
answerOptions.rationale: 'May' usually changes to 'might' in reported speech for consistency.

answerOptions.text: She told she might come to the party.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Told' needs an object. Use 'said' for statements without objects.

answerOptions.text: She said she could come to the party.
answerOptions.rationale: 'May' becomes 'might', not 'could'.

questions.hint: 'May' typically becomes 'might' in reported speech.

questions.question: Change this time reference:
questionParts: 'I visited them last week.' → He said he had visited them
questions.hint: 'Last week' becomes 'the previous week' or 'the week before'.

questions.question: Transform: 'Don't be late!'

answerOptions.text: She told me not to be late.
answerOptions.rationale: Perfect! Negative commands use 'told + object + not to + infinitive'.

answerOptions.text: She asked me not to be late.
answerOptions.rationale: This is a command (order), not a request. Use 'told'.

answerOptions.text: She told me don't be late.
answerOptions.rationale: Use infinitive structure: 'not to be late', not 'don't be late'.

answerOptions.text: She said me not to be late.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Said' doesn't take an object. Use 'told me'.

questions.hint: Negative commands: 'told + object + not to + infinitive'.

questions.question: Report this conditional:
questionParts: 'If I have time, I will help you.' → She said that if she
me.
questions.hint: In conditionals: Present → Past, Will → Would.

questions.question: How do we report: 'Where have you been?'

answerOptions.text: He asked where I had been.
answerOptions.rationale: Excellent! Present Perfect 'have been' → Past Perfect 'had been'.

answerOptions.text: He asked where have I been.
answerOptions.rationale: Use statement order and change tense: 'where I had been'.

answerOptions.text: He asked where I have been.
answerOptions.rationale: Present Perfect should change to Past Perfect: 'had been'.

answerOptions.text: He said where I had been.
answerOptions.rationale: Use 'asked' for questions, not 'said'.

questions.hint: Present Perfect becomes Past Perfect in reported questions.

questions.question: Transform with pronoun change:
questionParts: 'We are leaving now.' → They said
questions.hint: 'We' → 'they' and 'now' → 'then'.

questions.question: Report: 'I didn't see the movie.'

answerOptions.text: She said she hadn't seen the movie.
answerOptions.rationale: Perfect! Past Simple negative → Past Perfect negative.

answerOptions.text: She said she didn't see the movie.
answerOptions.rationale: Past Simple should change to Past Perfect: 'hadn't seen'.

answerOptions.text: She told she hadn't seen the movie.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Told' needs an object. Use 'said' without object.

answerOptions.text: She said she doesn't see the movie.
answerOptions.rationale: Wrong tense. Past negative should become Past Perfect negative.

questions.hint: Past Simple negative becomes Past Perfect negative.

questions.question: Complete this reported question:
questionParts: 'How old are you?' → She asked how old I
questions.hint: Present 'are' becomes past 'was' in reported speech.

questions.question: Transform: 'Please don't tell anyone.'

answerOptions.text: She asked me not to tell anyone.
answerOptions.rationale: Perfect! Polite negative request: 'asked + object + not to + infinitive'.

answerOptions.text: She told me not to tell anyone.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Please' indicates a request, so use 'asked', not 'told'.

answerOptions.text: She asked me don't tell anyone.
answerOptions.rationale: Use infinitive: 'not to tell', not 'don't tell'.

answerOptions.text: She said me not to tell anyone.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Said' doesn't take an object. Use 'asked me'.

questions.hint: Polite negative requests use 'asked + not to + infinitive'.

questions.question: Transform this complex sentence:
questionParts: 'I will call you when I arrive.' → He said he

questionParts.answer: would call me when he arrived
questionParts.label: multiple tense changes

questions.hint: Both verbs change: 'will call' → 'would call', 'arrive' → 'arrived'.

questions.question: Final challenge - Report: 'I wish I could speak French.'

answerOptions.text: She said she wished she could speak French.
answerOptions.rationale: Excellent! 'Wish' → 'wished', 'could' can stay the same as it's already past form.

answerOptions.text: She said she wish she could speak French.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Wish' should change to 'wished' in reported speech.

answerOptions.text: She told she wished she could speak French.
answerOptions.rationale: 'Told' needs an object. Use 'said' for statements.

answerOptions.text: She said she wished she can speak French.
answerOptions.rationale: Keep 'could' as it's already the past form of 'can'.

questions.hint: Present 'wish' becomes past 'wished'. 'Could' stays the same.
